newsitem.title: USA: Mass. Gov. calls out national guard after storm.
newsitem.headline: Mass. Gov. calls out national guard after storm.

text.p: Massachusetts Gov. William Weld Tuesday called out the state's National Guard to assist powerless residents, help clear roads and set up shelters.

Speaking to reporters from the emergency management agency bunker in Framingham in the central part of the state, Weld said he expected the state to offer financial assistance to "Worcester County, western Middlesex County and some parts of Essex...The city of Worcester may need help in particular.
"They had a $200,000 deficit in their snow budget even before this storm hit," Weld said.

The governor, who expected the state of emergency to last through Wednesday afternoon, said so many people were affected by the power outage because "it's not just the distribution lines that are down.
Some transmission lines are down as well and that's why you have as many as a quarter of a million households without electricity."
